steps.instruction: Season chicken breast with salt, pepper, and 1 tbsp olive oil. Let marinate while you prepare other ingredients.
steps.tips: Room temperature chicken cooks more evenly. Pat dry before seasoning.
steps.visual_cues: Chicken should be evenly coated with oil and seasoning

steps.instruction: Rinse quinoa in fine mesh strainer until water runs clear. Bring 2 cups water to boil, add quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
steps.tips: Rinsing removes bitterness. Don't lift lid while cooking.
steps.visual_cues: Water should be absorbed, quinoa fluffy when done

steps.instruction: While quinoa cooks, dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, and dice red onion. Set aside in separate bowls.
steps.tips: Keep vegetables separate until assembly to maintain freshness
steps.visual_cues: Uniform dice for even distribution and presentation

steps.instruction: Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Add marinated chicken and cook 6-7 minutes per side until golden brown and internal temp reaches 165°F.
steps.tips: Don't move chicken too early - let it develop a crust. Use thermometer for safety.
steps.visual_cues: Golden brown crust, juices run clear, no pink inside

steps.instruction: Remove chicken from heat and let rest for 5 minutes, then slice into strips against the grain.
steps.tips: Resting redistributes juices. Cutting against grain ensures tenderness.
steps.visual_cues: Chicken should slice easily, no juices running out rapidly

steps.instruction: Fluff quinoa with fork and let cool slightly. In large bowl, combine quinoa with diced vegetables.
steps.tips: Slightly cooled quinoa won't wilt the vegetables
steps.visual_cues: Quinoa should be fluffy, vegetables evenly distributed

steps.instruction: Whisk together lemon juice, remaining olive oil, salt and pepper. Pour over quinoa mixture and toss gently.
steps.tips: Taste dressing and adjust seasoning as needed
steps.visual_cues: Everything should be lightly coated, not soggy

steps.instruction: Divide quinoa salad into bowls, top with sliced chicken and a dollop of Greek yogurt. Serve immediately.
steps.tips: Serve at room temperature for best flavor
steps.visual_cues: Colorful, balanced presentation with protein prominently displayed

steps.instruction: Cut broccoli into bite-sized florets, slice bell pepper into strips, julienne carrots, trim snap peas, mince garlic and ginger.
steps.tips: Mise en place is crucial for stir-frying. Have everything ready before you start cooking.
steps.visual_cues: All vegetables should be uniform size for even cooking

steps.instruction: Heat wok or large skillet over high heat until smoking. Add vegetable oil and swirl to coat.
steps.tips: High heat is essential for proper stir-frying. Oil should shimmer but not burn.
steps.visual_cues: Wok should be very hot, oil moves freely when swirled

steps.instruction: Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant but not browned.
steps.tips: Keep aromatics moving constantly to prevent burning
steps.visual_cues: Should smell aromatic, garlic should not turn brown

steps.instruction: Add carrots and broccoli first. Stir-fry for 2 minutes, keeping vegetables moving constantly.
steps.tips: Harder vegetables go in first as they take longer to cook
steps.visual_cues: Vegetables should start to soften but remain bright in color

steps.instruction: Add bell peppers and snap peas. Continue stir-frying for 2 more minutes until all vegetables are crisp-tender.
steps.tips: Vegetables should retain some crunch - don't overcook
steps.visual_cues: All vegetables bright colored, slightly softened but still firm

steps.instruction: Add soy sauce and sesame oil. Toss everything together for 1 minute. Remove from heat and serve immediately.
steps.tips: Add sauce at the end to prevent burning. Serve immediately for best texture.
steps.visual_cues: Everything evenly coated, vegetables glistening with sauce

steps.instruction: Remove pizza dough from refrigerator and let come to room temperature for 30-45 minutes.
steps.tips: Room temperature dough is much easier to stretch and shape
steps.visual_cues: Dough should feel soft and pliable, not cold and stiff

steps.instruction: Place pizza stone in oven and preheat to highest temperature (usually 500-550°F) for at least 30 minutes.
steps.tips: Hot stone is crucial for crispy crust. Don't skip the preheating time.
steps.visual_cues: Oven should be fully heated, stone very hot

steps.instruction: Slice fresh mozzarella into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Pat dry with paper towels and set aside.
steps.tips: Patting mozzarella dry prevents soggy pizza
steps.visual_cues: Cheese slices should be uniform thickness, surface dry

steps.instruction: Mix crushed tomatoes with minced garlic and a pinch of salt. Set aside.
steps.tips: Simple sauce is best - don't overcomplicate it
steps.visual_cues: Sauce should be well combined but still chunky

steps.instruction: On floured surface, gently stretch dough from center outward to form 12-inch circle. Avoid using rolling pin if possible.
steps.tips: Let gravity help - hold dough up and let it stretch naturally
steps.visual_cues: Dough should be thin but not torn, roughly circular

steps.instruction: Transfer stretched dough to pizza peel dusted with flour or cornmeal.
steps.tips: Work quickly to prevent sticking. Shake peel to ensure dough moves freely.
steps.visual_cues: Dough should slide easily on the peel

steps.instruction: Spread thin layer of tomato sauce over dough, leaving 1-inch border for crust.
steps.tips: Less is more - too much sauce makes pizza soggy
steps.visual_cues: Even thin layer, crust border clearly visible

steps.instruction: Distribute mozzarella slices evenly over sauce, leaving some space between pieces.
steps.tips: Cheese will spread as it melts, so don't overcrowd
steps.visual_cues: Even distribution with small gaps between cheese pieces

steps.instruction: Slide pizza onto hot stone and bake 8-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese is bubbly with brown spots.
steps.tips: Watch carefully in last few minutes. Rotate halfway through if needed.
steps.visual_cues: Crust golden brown, cheese melted with brown bubbles

steps.instruction: Remove from oven, immediately top with fresh basil leaves and drizzle with olive oil. Let cool 2-3 minutes before slicing.
steps.tips: Fresh basil goes on after baking to prevent wilting
steps.visual_cues: Basil bright green, pizza set enough to slice cleanly

steps.instruction: Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Clean and oil the grill grates.
steps.tips: Clean, oiled grates prevent sticking and ensure good grill marks
steps.visual_cues: Grill should be hot, grates clean and lightly oiled

steps.instruction: Pat salmon fillets dry and season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Drizzle with 1 tbsp olive oil.
steps.tips: Dry fish ensures better searing. Season just before cooking.
steps.visual_cues: Fish should be dry, evenly seasoned and lightly oiled

steps.instruction: Trim woody ends from asparagus. Toss with remaining olive oil, salt and pepper.
steps.tips: Snap asparagus where it naturally breaks to remove woody parts
steps.visual_cues: Asparagus evenly coated with oil, ends freshly trimmed

steps.instruction: Place asparagus on grill first. Cook 6-8 minutes, turning occasionally, until tender-crisp.
steps.tips: Asparagus cooks faster than salmon, so start it first
steps.visual_cues: Asparagus should have grill marks but still be bright green

steps.instruction: Place salmon skin-side down on grill. Cook 4-5 minutes per side until internal temperature reaches 145°F.
steps.tips: Don't flip too early. Fish will release when ready. Use thermometer for doneness.
steps.visual_cues: Skin crispy, flesh flakes easily, internal temp 145°F

steps.instruction: Remove salmon and asparagus from grill. Squeeze fresh lemon juice over both and serve immediately.
steps.tips: Fresh lemon brightens the flavors. Serve hot off the grill.
steps.visual_cues: Fish should flake easily, asparagus tender but not mushy

steps.instruction: Drain and rinse black beans. Dice red onion, mince garlic, and slice avocados.
steps.tips: Rinsing beans removes excess sodium. Slice avocado just before serving to prevent browning.
steps.visual_cues: Beans clean, onion finely diced, avocado slices even

steps.instruction: Heat large skillet over medium heat. Add a bit of oil and sauté diced onion until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
steps.tips: Don't rush the onions - proper cooking develops sweetness
steps.visual_cues: Onions translucent and soft, lightly golden

steps.instruction: Add minced garlic, cumin, and chili powder. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
steps.tips: Toasting spices briefly releases their oils and intensifies flavor
steps.visual_cues: Spices should smell aromatic, not burn

steps.instruction: Add black beans and a splash of water. Cook 5-6 minutes, mashing some beans lightly, until heated through and slightly thickened.
steps.tips: Mashing some beans creates creaminess while keeping texture
steps.visual_cues: Mixture heated through, some beans mashed, slightly thick consistency

steps.instruction: While beans cook, warm corn tortillas in dry small pan over medium heat, about 30 seconds per side.
steps.tips: Warming tortillas makes them pliable and enhances flavor
steps.visual_cues: Tortillas should be warm and pliable, light brown spots OK

steps.instruction: Taste black bean mixture and season with salt, pepper, and lime juice to taste.
steps.tips: Lime juice brightens the flavors - add gradually to taste
steps.visual_cues: Mixture should taste well-seasoned and balanced

steps.instruction: Fill warm tortillas with black bean mixture, top with avocado slices and chopped cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.
steps.tips: Don't overfill tortillas. Let diners add their own toppings.
steps.visual_cues: Colorful presentation with green avocado and cilantro contrasting the black beans

steps.instruction: Cut chicken thighs into bite-sized pieces. Slice eggplant and bell peppers into strips. Pick Thai basil leaves.
steps.tips: Thigh meat stays more tender than breast in curry. Keep vegetables uniform for even cooking.
steps.visual_cues: All ingredients cut to similar bite-sized pieces

steps.instruction: Heat large pot over medium-high heat. Add 2-3 tbsp of thick coconut cream from top of can (don't shake can first).
steps.tips: Using thick cream first helps curry paste release oils and become fragrant
steps.visual_cues: Cream should sizzle gently, not burn

steps.instruction: Add green curry paste and fry for 2-3 minutes until fragrant and oil starts to separate.
steps.tips: This step develops the curry base flavor. Don't rush it.
steps.visual_cues: Paste should smell very aromatic, oil visible on surface

steps.instruction: Add chicken pieces and cook for 5-6 minutes, stirring frequently, until chicken is mostly cooked through.
steps.tips: Chicken doesn't need to be fully cooked here as it will finish in the sauce
steps.visual_cues: Chicken should be white on outside, slightly pink inside OK

steps.instruction: Add remaining coconut milk and bring to a gentle simmer. Add fish sauce and palm sugar, stir to dissolve.
steps.tips: Gentle simmer prevents coconut milk from breaking. Taste and adjust seasoning.
steps.visual_cues: Sauce should simmer gently with small bubbles around edges

steps.instruction: Add eggplant and bell peppers. Simmer 8-10 minutes until vegetables are tender but not mushy.
steps.tips: Eggplant should be creamy but still hold its shape
steps.visual_cues: Vegetables tender when pierced, sauce slightly thickened

steps.instruction: Taste and adjust seasoning with more fish sauce or sugar as needed. Stir in Thai basil leaves.
steps.tips: Balance is key in Thai cooking - sweet, salty, spicy, and aromatic should be harmonious
steps.visual_cues: Basil should wilt slightly but remain bright green

steps.instruction: Serve immediately over steamed jasmine rice with extra basil leaves and lime wedges on the side.
steps.tips: Curry is best served fresh and hot. Rice helps balance the heat.
steps.visual_cues: Colorful curry with green herbs, creamy sauce consistency

steps.instruction: Cook short grain rice according to package directions. Set aside to cool slightly.
steps.tips: Short grain rice is stickier and better for bibimbap than long grain
steps.visual_cues: Rice should be tender and slightly sticky

steps.instruction: Marinate thinly sliced beef in soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic, and a touch of sugar for 20 minutes.
steps.tips: Freeze beef for 30 minutes before slicing for easier, thinner cuts
steps.visual_cues: Beef should be very thinly sliced, well-coated with marinade

steps.instruction: Blanch spinach in boiling water for 30 seconds, drain, squeeze out excess water, and season with sesame oil and salt.
steps.tips: Squeeze spinach very well to remove water - it should form a compact bundle
steps.visual_cues: Spinach bright green, well-drained, seasoned evenly

steps.instruction: Blanch bean sprouts for 1 minute, drain well, and season with sesame oil, salt, and a touch of garlic.
steps.tips: Bean sprouts should retain some crunch - don't overcook
steps.visual_cues: Sprouts should still be crisp, lightly seasoned

steps.instruction: Julienne carrots and sauté in a bit of oil until slightly softened, about 3 minutes. Season with salt.
steps.tips: Carrots should still have some bite - not fully soft
steps.visual_cues: Carrots bright orange, slightly tender but still firm

steps.instruction: Slice mushrooms and sauté until golden and moisture has evaporated, about 5 minutes. Season with soy sauce.
steps.tips: Don't crowd mushrooms or they'll steam instead of browning
steps.visual_cues: Mushrooms golden brown, no liquid in pan

steps.instruction: Cook marinated beef in hot pan for 2-3 minutes until just cooked through. Don't overcook.
steps.tips: High heat and quick cooking keeps beef tender
steps.visual_cues: Beef browned outside, still tender, marinade caramelized

steps.instruction: Fry eggs sunny-side up in clean pan until whites are set but yolks are still runny.
steps.tips: Runny yolk acts as a sauce when mixed into the bibimbap
steps.visual_cues: Whites completely set, yolks golden and liquid

steps.instruction: Divide warm rice among serving bowls. Arrange each vegetable component in separate sections over rice.
steps.tips: Traditional presentation has each component in its own section creating a colorful wheel
steps.visual_cues: Rice forms base, vegetables arranged in distinct colorful sections

steps.instruction: Top each bowl with cooked beef and place fried egg in center.
steps.tips: The egg should be the crowning centerpiece of each bowl
steps.visual_cues: Beef distributed evenly, egg prominently centered

steps.instruction: Serve with gochujang (Korean chili paste) on the side for mixing.
steps.tips: Let diners add gochujang to their taste preference
steps.visual_cues: Colorful, organized presentation ready for mixing

steps.instruction: To eat, mix everything together with chopsticks or spoon, breaking the egg yolk to coat everything.
steps.tips: The mixing is part of the dining experience - encourage diners to combine everything
steps.visual_cues: When mixed, should look like colorful fried rice with egg coating

steps.instruction: Soak rice noodles in warm water for 20-30 minutes until soft and pliable. Drain well.
steps.tips: Noodles should be soft but still have some firmness - they'll finish cooking in the wok
steps.visual_cues: Noodles bendable without breaking, opaque white color

steps.instruction: Mix sauce: combine fish sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, and lime juice in small bowl. Set aside.
steps.tips: Taste the sauce - it should be balanced: salty, sweet, sour, and slightly funky
steps.visual_cues: Sauce should be well combined, slightly thick consistency

steps.instruction: Clean shrimp, removing shells and deveining. Pat dry. Rinse bean sprouts and drain. Chop peanuts and slice lime into wedges.
steps.tips: Dry shrimp well to prevent spattering. Have all ingredients ready before starting to cook.
steps.visual_cues: Shrimp clean and dry, bean sprouts crisp, garnishes prepared

steps.instruction: Heat wok over high heat until smoking. Add oil and swirl to coat.
steps.tips: High heat is crucial for proper wok cooking - don't compromise on this
steps.visual_cues: Wok should be very hot, oil should shimmer and move freely

steps.instruction: Add shrimp to wok and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until just pink and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
steps.tips: Don't overcook shrimp - they'll continue cooking from residual heat
steps.visual_cues: Shrimp pink and curled, no translucent parts remaining

steps.instruction: Add more oil to wok if needed. Crack eggs into wok and scramble quickly, breaking into small pieces.
steps.tips: Eggs should form small curds, not large pieces. Work quickly.
steps.visual_cues: Eggs should be in small, soft curds throughout

steps.instruction: Add drained noodles to wok with scrambled eggs. Toss gently for 1-2 minutes until heated through.
steps.tips: Be gentle with noodles to prevent breaking. Use tongs or chopsticks to toss.
steps.visual_cues: Noodles should be heated through, mixed with egg pieces

steps.instruction: Add prepared sauce and toss everything together for 1-2 minutes until noodles are well coated.
steps.tips: Sauce should coat noodles evenly and reduce slightly
steps.visual_cues: Noodles glossy with sauce, slightly caramelized color

steps.instruction: Return shrimp to wok, add bean sprouts and toss for 30 seconds. Serve immediately topped with peanuts and lime wedges.
steps.tips: Bean sprouts should stay crisp. Serve immediately while hot.
steps.visual_cues: Bean sprouts just warmed through but still crisp, everything well combined
